Sorting tbls of intervals

Interval tbls can be sorted using dplyr::arrange(). See examples for sorting by chrom and start, and by size using dplyr::mutate().

Examples


# unsorted tbl
x <- trbl_interval(
  ~chrom, ~start, ~end,
  'chr1', 150,    500,
  'chr1', 1,      100,
  'chr2', 500,    1000,
  'chr2', 100,    300
)

# sort by start
dplyr::arrange(x, start)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   chrom start   end
#>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     1   100
#> 2  chr2   100   300
#> 3  chr1   150   500
#> 4  chr2   500  1000

# sort by descending start
dplyr::arrange(x, desc(start))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   chrom start   end
#>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr2   500  1000
#> 2  chr1   150   500
#> 3  chr2   100   300
#> 4  chr1     1   100

# sort by chrom and start
dplyr::arrange(x, chrom, start)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   chrom start   end
#>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     1   100
#> 2  chr1   150   500
#> 3  chr2   100   300
#> 4  chr2   500  1000

# sort by size
x <- dplyr::mutate(x, .size = end - start)
dplyr::arrange(x, .size)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>   chrom start   end .size
#>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  chr1     1   100    99
#> 2  chr2   100   300   200
#> 3  chr1   150   500   350
#> 4  chr2   500  1000   500
